      • stamp

        public static Timestamp stamp(DetachedTimestampFile fileTimestamp)
                       throws IOException
        Create timestamp with the aid of a remote calendar. May be specified multiple times.
        Parameters:
        fileTimestamp - The Detached Timestamp File.
        Returns:
        The plain array buffer of stamped.
        Throws:
        IOException - if fileTimestamp is not valid, or the stamp procedure fails.

                              List<String> calendarsUrl,
                              Integer m)
                       throws IOException
        Create timestamp with the aid of a remote calendar. May be specified multiple times.
        Parameters:
        fileTimestamp - The Detached Timestamp File.
        calendarsUrl - The list of calendar urls.
        m - The number of calendar to use.
        Returns:
        The plain array buffer of stamped.
        Throws:
        IOException - if fileTimestamp is not valid, or the stamp procedure fails.

      • stamp

        public static Timestamp stamp(DetachedTimestampFile fileTimestamp,
                              List<String> calendarsUrl,
                              Integer m,
                              HashMap<String,String> privateCalendarsUrl)
                       throws IOException
        Create timestamp with the aid of a remote calendar. May be specified multiple times.
        Parameters:
        fileTimestamp - The timestamp to stamp.
        calendarsUrl - The list of calendar urls.
        m - The number of calendar to use.
        privateCalendarsUrl - The list of private calendar urls with signature.
        Returns:
        The plain array buffer of stamped.
        Throws:
        IOException - if fileTimestamp is not valid, or the stamp procedure fails.

      • stamp

                              List<String> calendarsUrl,

                       throws IOException
        Create timestamp with the aid of a remote calendar. May be specified multiple times.
        Parameters:
        fileTimestamps - The list of timestamp to stamp.
        calendarsUrl - The list of calendar urls.
        m - The number of calendar to use.
        privateCalendarsUrl - The list of private calendar urls with signature.
        Returns:
        The plain array buffer of stamped.
        Throws:
        IOException - if fileTimestamp is not valid, or the stamp procedure fails.

      • verify

        public static HashMap<VerifyResult.Chains,VerifyResult> verify(DetachedTimestampFile ots,
                                                               DetachedTimestampFile stamped)
                                                        throws Exception
        Compare and verify a detached timestamp.
        Parameters:
        ots - The DetachedTimestampFile containing the proof to verify.
        stamped - The DetachedTimestampFile containing the stamped data.
        Returns:
        Hashmap of block heights & timestamps indexed by chain: timestamp in seconds from 1 January 1970.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the verification procedure fails.

      • verify

        public static HashMap<VerifyResult.Chains,VerifyResult> verify(Timestamp timestamp)
                                                        throws Exception
        Verify a timestamp.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp.
        Returns:
        HashMap of block heights & timestamps indexed by chain: timestamp in seconds from 1 January 1970.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the verification procedure fails.

      • verify

        public static Long verify(BitcoinBlockHeaderAttestation attestation,
                          byte[] msg)
                   throws VerificationException,
                          Exception
        Verify an Bitcoin Block Header Attestation. Bitcoin verification uses a bitcoin node as default, if the node is not reachable or it fails, uses Lite-client verification.
        Parameters:
        attestation - The BitcoinBlockHeaderAttestation attestation.
        msg - The digest to verify.
        Returns:
        The unix timestamp in seconds from 1 Jamuary 1970.
        Throws:
        VerificationException - if it doesn't check the merkle root of the block.
        Exception - if the verification procedure fails.

      • verify

        public static Long verify(LitecoinBlockHeaderAttestation attestation,
                          byte[] msg)
                   throws VerificationException,
                          Exception
        Verify an Litecoin Block Header Attestation. Litecoin verification uses only lite-client verification.
        Parameters:
        attestation - The LitecoinBlockHeaderAttestation attestation.
        msg - The digest to verify.
        Returns:
        The unix timestamp in seconds from 1 Jamuary 1970.
        Throws:
        VerificationException - if it doesn't check the merkle root of the block.
        Exception - if the verification procedure fails.

      • upgrade

        public static boolean upgrade(DetachedTimestampFile detachedTimestamp)
                       throws Exception
        Upgrade a timestamp.
        Parameters:
        detachedTimestamp - The DetachedTimestampFile containing the proof to verify.
        Returns:
        a boolean representing if the timestamp has changed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the upgrading procedure fails.

      • upgrade

        public static boolean upgrade(Timestamp timestamp)
                       throws Exception
        Attempt to upgrade an incomplete timestamp to make it verifiable. Note that this means if the timestamp that is already complete, False will be returned as nothing has changed.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to upgrade.
        Returns:
        a boolean representing if the timestamp has changed.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the upgrading procedure fails.
